pull.title: prefer const string& over char* in CDB and CWalletDB constructor
pull.body:
2nd commit:
cleanup class private and public areas in walletdb

events.message:
prefer const string& over char* in CDB and CWalletDB constructor

- also make parameter of CDBEnv::CheckpointLSN a constant reference

cleanup class private and public areas in walletdb

- only code movement

rename.from: prefer std::string over char* in CDB constructor
rename.to: prefer const string& over char* in CDB and CWalletDB constructor

events.body: I updated the CWalletDB constructor to const std::string&, as @laanwj suggested.

Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED BUILD/TEST, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4931_93f84d0417e8e1c590b405bde6e153b413bd43f2/ for binaries and test log.

This could happen for one of several reasons:
1. It chanages paths in makefile.linux-mingw or otherwise changes build scripts in a way that made them incompatible with the automated testing scripts (please tweak those patches in qa/pull-tester)
2. It adds/modifies tests which test network rules (thanks for doing that), which conflicts with a patch applied at test time
3. It does not build on either Linux i386 or Win32 (via MinGW cross compile)
4. The test suite fails on either Linux i386 or Win32
5. The block test-cases failed (lookup the first bNN identifier which failed in https://github.com/TheBlueMatt/test-scripts/blob/master/FullBlockTestGenerator.java)

If you believe this to be in error, please ping BlueMatt on freenode or TheBlueMatt here.

This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

@BitcoinPullTester Error was caused by: `tail: write error: Broken pipe
tail: write error`... seems unrelated.
